author: jason.carver
content: Ah interesting. Yeah, I haven't been following it, since trinity is shelved and I'm focused on Portal clients.

author: jason.carver
content:
Maybe "classic" Beam Sync (by starting to validate execution right away from the head of the chain) isn't helpful in a snap sync world, because I suspect it would take longer to get the content you need by using `GetTrieNodes`. It's probably long enough that you'd never catch up, and might as well wait for snap to finish.
But it would still be super useful to support the `eth_` endpoints before sync has finished (still takes at least several hours, last I heard), which you could support by using the same principle as Beam Sync (like an `eth_call` that pauses to get data as needed, whenever it's missing locally)
